alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 5:30PM MST until September 02 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PARIA RIVER REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM ARIZONA TIME/1030 PM NAVAJO NATION TIME/ THIS EVENING... At 524 PM ARIZONA TIME /624 PM NAVAJO NATION TIME/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain over the Paria River. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the warning area will cause mud slides near steep terrain. The mud slide can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Paria River. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Paria River. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paria Canyon, Cathedral Wash at Lees Ferry, Lees Ferry CG, Paria Beach, and portions of the Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. This includes the following slot canyons... Paria River upstream of Lees Ferry. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Paria River and Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get out of the Paria River slot canyon! Flood waters will flow down the Paria River, reaching the confluence with the Colorado River at Lees Ferry around 8pm-9pm Arizona time, or between 9pm-10pm Navajo Nation time. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
